# Contribution Guidelines

Thank you for considering contributing to our project! We appreciate the time and effort you put into making this project better.

## How to Contribute

1. Fork the repository to your GitHub account.
2. Clone the forked repository to your local machine:

````
git clone https://github.com/your-username/repository.git
````
3. Create a new branch for your feature or bug fix:
````
git checkout -b feature-or-bugfix-branch
````
4. Make your changes and commit them with descriptive commit messages:
````
git commit -m "Add feature or fix bug"
````
5. Push your changes to your GitHub repository:
````
 git push origin feature-or-bugfix-branch
````
6. Open a pull request on the original repository.


## Pull Request Guidelines
### Please ensure that your pull request meets the following criteria:

- Follow the coding style and conventions used in the project.
- Include tests for new features or bug fixes.
- Update documentation if needed.
- Ensure that your code compiles and runs successfully.

## ISSUES
Feel free to submit issues and enhancement requests. Make sure to include a clear and detailed description of the problem or feature request.

## License
By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the [project license](LICENSE).
